msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

For compatibility reasons it was decided that the new functionality remain integrated with the old framework, although we will continue to build two separate SWCs, one with primarily existing framework classes, and one with new Flex 4 classes. This change removes duplicate names from the Flex 4 framework to avoid class name overlapping with the old framework code.  The naming overlap consists of two major areas:  New Components, and New Effects
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Adding new SetAction effect, plus minor improvements to effects overall. This new effect combines the old SetPropertyAction and SetStyleAction effects, figuring out for the named property whether it is a property or a style of the target object. Also, added new capabilities to Animation class and fixed some problems with easing default values.

fix invalid html ins ASDoc comment
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Added new Rotate effect. Also, minor API additions to Animation class and minor refactoring of AnimateFilterInstance.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Fixed SDK-16615, SDK-16576, SDK-16631, SDK-16635, TH-1507, SDK-16622. This is another round of Animation/effect changes. Some are API improvements (such as adding proper event dispatching to Animate), most are fixes for various SDK and Thermo bugs that have been filed. Here's an explanation of the changes per file:

All of the changes here are to add AnimationEvent dispatching to this class, similar to what we had in TweenEffect for TweenEvent. Note that we have a new event now, ANIMATION_REPEAT, and that ANIMATION_END only gets sent out once for each animation (instead of after each repetition, which is what the Flex3 effects did)
We were noop'ing 0-duration animations. We now handle this correctly by sending out a START event, then send out UPDATE/END events with the final value
These changes relate to two problems/fixes:
- Handling styles correctly before effects are completely set up (sdk-16615)
We didn't handle the situation where the user supplied only one of left/right or one of bottom/top.
We weren't correctly detecting that colors were not being set by the user, which messed up assumptions for transition from/to values
Fixes to support property coloring during transitions
Removed trace() statements that crept in there in an earlier checkin
